intro: Calycera neuquenensis, commonly known as the Neuquén calycera, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant features showy, five-lobed flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
